4.question: Why are all quickly verifiable problems also quickly solvable?
4.true_ans: This is the P versus NP problem and it remains open.
4.first_ans: Not all quickly verifiable problems are also quickly solvable.Not all quickly verifiable problems are also quickly solvable. The concept of NP-complete problems and the P versus NP problem demonstrate that there are problems that can be verified in polynomial time but not necessarily solved in polynomial time.
4.fwd_final_ans: No, not all quickly verifiable problems are also quickly solvable.
4.fwd_final_ans_exp: The concept of NP-complete problems and the P versus NP problem demonstrate that there are problems that can be verified in polynomial time but not necessarily solved in polynomial time.
4.bck_final_ans: No, not all quickly verifiable problems are also quickly solvable.
4.bck_final_ans_exp: The discussion revolves around the P versus NP problem, which asks whether every problem whose solution can be quickly verified can also be quickly solved. The external sources provide insights into the complexity classes P and NP, and the relationship between verifiability and solvability of problems. It is logical to conclude that not all quickly verifiable problems are also quickly solvable, as the P versus NP problem remains unsolved and is a major open question in computer science.
